solution.explanation: Enforced - to make people obey a law Imposed- to establish something as a rule to be obeyed Diluted- to thin down or weaken as by mixing with water or other liquid Abandoned- left completely and no longer used or wanted Disregarded- lack of consideration or respect

Laborious - needing a lot of time and effort Assiduous- showing hard work, care, and attention to detail Unsophisticated - not knowing things that educated people know Profane- showing a lack of respect for sacred or holy things Pompous- showing that you think you are more important than other people

Probe - to ask questions in order to ﬁnd out secret or hidden information Search - to examine somebody/something carefully because you are looking for something Motivate- to cause somebody to act in a particular way Invite- to ask somebody to come somewhere or to do something Push- to use force to move somebody/something forward

Clandestine - planned or done in secret Undercover- working or happening secretly Blatant- very clear or obvious Ornate- covered with a lot of small complicated designs as decoration Open- not closed or covered

question: I  may  sound  crazy  but  I  am  not an [ imbecile ]. SSC MTS 13/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Imbecile - a stupid & silly person Dunce- a person who is slow at learning Credible- something/someone that you can believe Prudent- sensiblel when making judgements and decisions Sage- a profoundly wise person

Bulky- large and heavy and therefore diﬃcult to move or carry Massive- very large in size, amount, or number Airy- having a lot of fresh air inside Soft- smooth and pleasant to touch Scanty- too small in size or amount

Maestro- someone who is very skilled or gifted in a speciﬁed art Genius- person who has very great and unusual ability Senile- behaving in a confused and strange way Slender- smaller in amount or size Novice- a person who is new and without experience in a certain job

Uncanny - very strange, that you cannot easily explain Spooky- inspiring a feeling of fear, strange and frightening Deranged- thinking and behaving in a way that is not normal Reckless- showing a lack of care about risks or danger Insightful- having or showing an accurate and deep understanding

August - respected and impressive Eminent- famous and important Imminent- almost certain to happen very soon Permanent- lasting for a long time or forever Illicit- not allowed by law or by the rules of society

Mandate - the power that is oﬃcially given to a group of people to do something Command- to tell or order somebody to do something Question- a sentence or phrase that asks for an answer Request- an act of asking for something Enquire- to ask for information about something

Tenderness - the quality of being gentle, loving, or kind Kindness- the quality of being kind Ruthlessness- the quality of having no mercy or pity for other people Severity- seriousness of something bad or unpleasant Spitefulness - quality of wanting to annoy, upset, or hurt another person

Acute - very serious Dire- very bad or serious Obtuse- slow to or not wanting to understand something Faithful- always staying with and supporting a person, organization or belief Chronic- that continues for a long time

Propitious - likely to produce a successful result Auspicious- that seems likely to be successful in the future Conciliatory- that tries to end an argument or a disagreement Cogent- clearly expressed in a way that inﬂuences what people believe Inimical- harmful to something
Bloom - to produce ﬂowers Flower - a plant that is grown for its ﬂowers Fade- to disappear slowly from sight, hearing, memory Drop - to let something fall Wither- to become weaker then disappear

Conﬁscated - to take something away from somebody as a punishment Seized- to take hold of something suddenly and ﬁrmly Marinated- to pour a marinade over meat or ﬁsh Acquitted- to state formally that a person is not guilty of a crime Liberated- free from traditional opinions or ways of behaving

Satiate - to completely satisfy a desire or need Satisfy- to make somebody pleased by doing or giving him/her what he/she wants Pamper- to take care of somebody very well Culminate- to reach a ﬁnal result Agitate- to make other people feel very strongly about something

Flagrant - shocking because of being so bad and so obvious Atrocious- very cruel and shocking Favourable- showing liking or approval Wonderful- extremely good Magniﬁcent- extremely impressive and attractive

question: This  style  is  ideal  for  men  of  all ages who wish to convey a [ dapper ] look. SSC MTS 21/07/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Dapper - neat and trim in dress and appearance Stylish- fashionable and attractiveMessy- that makes somebody/something dirty Filthy- extremely or unpleasantly dirty Healthy- showing good health of body or mind

Culpable - responsible for something bad that has happened Guilty- being responsible for doing something wrong Irresponsible- not thinking about the effect your actions will have Immune- having natural protection against a certain disease or illness Innocent- not having done wrong

question: He  was  quick  in  his  anger,  but easily [ appeased ] . SSC MTS 21/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Appeased - to make somebody calmer or less angry Paciﬁed- to calm the anger or agitation Unsatisﬁed- feeling that something is not enough or not good enough Bugged- to annoy or worry somebody Dejected- very unhappy because you are disappointed

Revile - criticize in an abusive or angrily insulting manner Abuse- to use something in a bad or dishonest way Silence- no noise or sound at all Incite- to encourage somebody to do something Discourage- to stop somebody doing something

question: They  are [ perceptive ] observers  of social groups. SSC MTS 22/07/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Perceptive - quick to notice or understand things Astute- very clever, good at judging people or situations Conﬂicted- to disagree with or be different from somebody/something Imbecile- a stupid person Witless- stupid or showing no intelligence

Voracious - eating or wanting large amounts of food Greedy- having or showing a selﬁsh desire for wealth and possessions Restrained- not showing strong feelings Moderate- neither too much nor too little Truthful- honest and not containing or telling any lies

question: Both  songs  have  been  reworked giving them fresh [ impetus ] SSC MTS 22/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Impetus - something that encourages something else to happen Incitement- the act of encouraging someone to do or feel something Detachment- a feeling of not being emotionally involved Aversion- a strong feeling of not liking somebody/some thing Disfavour- put at a disadvantage or treat as undesirable.

Vanquish - to defeat somebody completely in a contest, war, etc. Defeat - to win a game, a ﬁght, a vote, etc. against somebody Acquit- to state formally that a person is not guilty of a crime Surrender- to stop ﬁghting and admit that you have lost Flee- to run away or escape from something

Astute - very clever, good at judging people or situations Shrewd- able to make good decisions because you understand a situation well Dull- not interesting or exciting, boring Impolite- behaving in a way that is not socially correct Crude- simple and basic, without much detail, skill, etc.

Expository - intended to explain or describe something Illustrative- serving as an example or explanation Temperamental- often and suddenly changing the way you behave or feel Obligatory- that you must do Dubious- not sure or certain

Sparkling - shining with many small points of light Gleaming- bright and shiny from being cleaned Dismal - causing or showing sadness Muﬄed- to make a sound quieter and less clear Unexciting- not interesting, stirring, or stimulating; unexciting but likable. SSC CHSL 2021 Tier - 1
